original_content:
You smell smoke and the piece of gear you are working on stops working, probably at an inopportune time. You open it up and immediately see the burned remains of a resistor. You dont have the schematic, the Internet has nothing to say, and the markings on the resistor are burned away. What do you do? [Learn Electronics Repair] has some advice.
The resistor is probably open, but even if it isnt, you cant count on any measurement you make. The burning could easily change the value. The technique comes from comments on one of his earlier videos where he had such a burned resistor but was able to find the correct value. He decided to test the suggestion: cut away the burned resistor and measure the pieces that are left. It probably wont give you the exact value, but it will get you in the ballpark.
So a rotary tool did the surgery, and you can see it all in the video below. We arent sure this method would work on every type of resistor you might encounter, and surface mount will also present special problems. However, if you are stabbing in the dark anyway, it wont hurt to try.
Everyone knows the smoke that comes out is magic. Sometimes, you cut into components by necessity. Other times, it is for arts sake.
title: 「焼き付いた抵抗器の残骸から正しい値を求める方法」
body: 焼けた抵抗器の正確な値を見つける方法についてのアドバイス。焼けた抵抗器を切って残りを測定し、おおよその値を求める。方法は常に正確ではないが、試す価値はある。
titles: 「焼き付いた抵抗器の残骸から正しい値を求める方法」
「焼けた抵抗器の値を測定できない時の対処方法」
「焼けた抵抗器を切り取って残った部分から値を推測する方法」
「焼けた抵抗器の値を探すための非常に効果的な方法」
「抵抗器の焼損を修復するための応急処置」
